name: Kepler-204
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-204 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-204 is a star with 1.514 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.24 times its radius. It is located 2285.02 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-204 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-204 b

Kepler-204 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 14.40 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-204.

The mass of Kepler-204 b is 8.95 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-204 b is 2.53 that of Earth. At 8.95 Earth masses, Kepler-204 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-204 c

Kepler-204 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 25.66 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-204.

The mass of Kepler-204 c is 3.91 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-204 c is 1.79 that of Earth. At 3.91 Earth masses, Kepler-204 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-204, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
